data.title: Historical Events on December 6
data.meta_description: Historical events for the 6th of December. See what famous, interesting and notable events happened throughout history on December 6.
data.text:
Leo VIII elected Pope

BÃ©la I of Hungary is crowned king of Hungary

Jean Bodels "Jeu de St Nicholas" premieres in Arras

Northern Dutch coast flooded, "Saint-Nicolas Flood"

Mongol Siege of Kyiv

Mongols led by Batu Khan occupy and destroy Kyiv after an 8 day siege; out of 50,000 people in the city only 2,000 survive

Aquinas' Divine Revelation

Thomas Aquinas, thought to have had a mystical experience in Naples, refuses to continue his work "I cannot, because all that I have written seems like straw to me"

Barcelona Right to Expel Jews

Don Alfonso V of Aragon grants Barcelona the right to exclude Jews

Pope Clement VII Flees

Pope Clement VII escapes imprisonment in the Castel Sant'Angelo in Rome, fleeing to Orvieto disguised as a peddler

Quito, Ecuador, founded by Spanish colonists on the ruins of an Inca city

1st predicted transit of Venus (Kepler) is observed

Don Francisco de Mello appointed land guardian of South Netherlands

Pride's Purge: Thomas Pride prevents 96 presbyterians from sitting in English parliament

Charles VI's Pragmatic Sanction

Holy Roman Emperor Charles VI's Pragmatic Sanction with the Diet of Hungary recognizes the King's daughters as successors

1st play in American colonies acted by professional players in New York

First recorded appendectomy performed by Claudius Amyand at St George's Hospital in London

Jacobite Army Retreats

Bonnie Prince Charlie's Jacobite army retreats to Scotland

British troops under Robert Clive occupy Fulta, India

Laurens Pieter van de Speigel is appointed Dutch pension advisor

The U.S. Congress moves from New York City to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

Veterinary school in Utrecht opens

US National Observatory Proposed

US President John Quincy Adams suggests establishment of a national observatory

Schumann's 4th Symphony

Robert Schumann's 4th Symphony in D minor premieres

Amsterdam-Utrecht railway opens

Alpha Sigma Phi Fraternity is founded at Yale College.

La Damnation de Faust

Hector Berlioz's dramatic oratorio "La Damnation de Faust" premieres, conducted by the composer at the OpÃ©ra-Comique, Paris

Harriet Tubman Escapes

Harriet Tubman escapes from slavery in Maryland for the 2nd and final time

Lincoln Orders Santee Sioux Hanged

US President Abraham Lincoln orders hanging of 39 Santee Sioux Indians

Battle of Deveaux's Neck, South Carolina

13th Amendment of the United States Constitution is ratified, abolishing slavery (except as a punishment for crime whereof the party shall have been duly convicted) [1]

Chicago water supply tunnel 3,227 m into Lake Michigan completed

Colored National Labor Union, 1st Black labor convention meets at Union League Hall in Washington, D.C.

1st international football game in US: Yale 2, Eton (England) 1 in New Haven, Connecticut

44th Congress (1875-77) convenes

1st crematorium in US begins operation, Washington, Pennsylvania

Hayes, Tilden Election

US Electoral College casts their votes in the disputed election between Rutherford B. Hayes and Samuel J. Tilden; two sets of conflicting results are returned to Congress the next day

Edison's Phonograph

Thomas Edison enters the offices of Scientific American and turns the crank on his cylinder phonograph, astonishing those present with the recording, "Good morning. How do you do? How do you like the phonograph?" [1]

1877 Washington Post publishes 1st edition

Atmosphere of Venus detected during transit

Aluminum capstone set atop Washington Monument, Washington, D.C., making it the tallest human-built structure in the world (overtaking Cologne Cathedral)

D T Suzuki found the awakening at Engakuji temple, in Kamakura

London becomes the world's first city to host licenced taxicabs

Sumatra Atjehs guerilla leader Panglima Polim surrenders

Monroe Doctrine Confirmed

Theodore Roosevelt confirms Monroe Doctrine (Roosevelt Corollary)

The British grant Transvaal self-government

Coal mine explosions in Monongah, West Virginia kills 361

China votes for universal human rights

White Sox beat Giants 9-4 in exhibition game in Tokyo

German troops over run Lodz

World War I: The Central Powers under General Mackensen capture Bucharest

French munition ship SS Mont Blanc collides with Norwegian SS Imo in Halifax harbour, Canada, resulting explosion kills at least 1,700 and injures more than 9,000 people - worldâs largest pre-atomic explosion [1]

1917 Taking advantage of the temporary relaxation of authority in Russia, Finland declares itself a republic, following the Ukraine on 20 November

Anglo-Irish Treaty Signed

Anglo-Irish Treaty signed; Ireland receives dominion status; partition creates Northern Ireland

Liberal Party Victory

Canada's Liberal Party and its leader Mackenzie King defeats Arthur Meighen's Conservative Party and Thomas Crerar' Progressive Party in general election, goes on to form a minority government

1st constitution of Irish Free State comes into operation

1922 1st electric power line commercial carrier in US, Utica, NY

First US Presidential Radio Address

1st US Presidential address broadcast on radio by President Calvin Coolidge

Italy, Britain & Egypt sign Jaghbub accord (Italy)

1925 Record 73,000 pay to watch Chicago Bears beat NY Giants 19-7

Turkey introduces female suffrage

Ulysses Ban Lifted

Ban on James Joyce's "Ulysses" in US lifted

117 Spanish knights under capt Piet Laros return to Netherlands

French-German friendship treaty drawn up (Ribbentrop-Bonnet Pact)

5th Heisman Trophy Award: Nile Kinnick, Iowa (HB)

Gestapo arrest German resistance fighter/poster artist Helen Ernst

Pietro Badoglio Resigns

Pietro Badoglio resigns as viceroy of Ethiopia

Dutch & British pilots see Japanese invasion fleet at Singapore

1941 NYC Council agrees to build Idlewild (Kennedy) Airport in Queens

Dutch Commonwealth Begins

Queen Wilhelmina announces Dutch Commonwealth

1942 RAF bombs Philips factory (150 die)

US 95th Infantry division reaches Westwall

Everglades National Park

The Everglades National Park in Florida is dedicated by President Harry S. Truman

Mirabile Illud

Pope Pius XII publishes encyclical Mirabile illud

Czech government tells Israeli ambassador that he is persona non grata

Brown's Lou "Toe" Groza kicks 8 PATs, beating Giants 62-14

Beauvoir Receives Prix Goncourt

Simone de Beauvoir receives the Prix Goncourt prize in French literature

New York psychologist Joyce Brothers wins "$64,000 Question" with topic of boxing

Against the background of the Soviet invasion of Hungary the nations square off at the Melbourne Olympics in a famous water polo match; game called off with Hungary leading 4-0 and near riot halted by police; Hungary goes on to win gold medal

1956 Australian swimmer David Theile sets world record 1:02.2 to win the 100m backstroke gold medal at the Melbourne Olympics

Australian Win Swim Relay

Australian women's 4 Ã 100m freestyle relay team of Dawn Fraser, Faith Leech, Sandra Morgan & Lorraine Crapp swim world record 4:17.1 and beat powerful US team to win the gold medal at the Melbourne Olympics

1956 German WWII prisoner of war Helmut Bantz and Soviet gymnast Valentin Muratov tie for the vault gold medal with 18.85 points at the Melbourne Olympics

Mandela Arrested

Nelson Mandela & 156 others arrested for political activities in South Africa

1956 Randhir Singh Gentle scores the winner as India beats Pakistan, 1-0 in the Melbourne Olympics field hockey final to win it's 6th consecutive gold medal in the sport

1956 Soviet gymnast Viktor Chukarin follows his parallel bars gold medal with the individual all-round title and teams gold at the Melbourne Olympics

1st US attempt to launch a satellite fails-Vanguard rocket blows up

1957 AFL-CIO votes to expel Teamsters (readmitted in October 1987)

1957 Indonesia begins nationalizing Dutch possessions

Sessions' 3rd Symphony

Roger Sessions' 3rd Symphony premieres in Boston with Charles Munch conducting the Boston Symphony

US lunar probe Pioneer 3 reaches 107,269 km, falls back

MLB American League grants American entertainer and businessman Gene Autry a franchise: Los Angeles Angels

Davis 1st African American Winner

27th Heisman Trophy Award: Ernie Davis, Syracuse RB; 1st African American to win)

US abandons Skybolt ballistic missile program

Johnson's 31 Medal Recipients

President Lyndon B. Johnson confers Presidential Medal of Freedom on 31 recipients selected by JFK, including: contralto Marian Anderson; diplomat Ralph Bunche; cellist Pablo Casals; Supreme Court Justice Felix Frankfurter; labor leader George Meaney; architect Mies van der Rohe; pianist Rudolf Serkin; writers E. B. White and Thorton Wilder; and painter Andrew Wyeth; as well as posthumously to JFK himself, and Pope John XXIII

1963 Test Cricket debut of Graeme Pollock at the Gabba

1963 The Beatles begin a tradition of releasing a Christmas record for fan club members

"Rudolph The Red-Nosed Reindeer" 1st airs on TV

1964 KTVR TV channel 13 in La Grande, OR (PBS) begins broadcasting

Antonio Segni Resigns

President Antonio Segni of Italy resigns

2 trucks crash into a crowd of dancers in Sotouboua Togo, kills 125

1965 Pakistan's Islamic Ideology Advisory Committee recommends that Islamic Studies be made a compulsory subject for Muslim students from primary to graduate level.

USSR performs nuclear test at Sary Shagan USSR

Beggar's Banquet

Decca Records releases Rolling Stones album "Beggar's Banquet" in UK, the last during Brian Jones' lifetime (US release the next day)

1968 Major League Baseball dismisses Commissioner William Eckert after 3 years

1968 PBA National Bowling Championship won by Wayne Zahn (29)

1968 WKID (WSCV) TV channel 51 in Fort Lauderdale, Florida (IND) 1st broadcast

Rolling Stones at Altamont

300,000 attend free concert featuring The Rolling Stones in Altamont, California; the event is marred by violence and four deaths

1969 USSR performs nuclear test

Cleveland Cavaliers 1st NBA home victory, beating Buffalo Braves 108-106

A woman dies trying to salvage property from the Salvation Army Citadel in Belfast after bomb which started a large fire in an adjoining building

1971 Lewis Franklin Powell confirmed as US Supreme Court justice

Bahrain's constitution goes into effect

Gerald Ford VP

Gerald Ford sworn-in as first unelected Vice President, succeeds Spiro Agnew who resigned over corruption allegations

1973 NL votes to move San Diego Padres to Washington, D.C. (doesn't happen)

Ding Dong, Ding Dong

George Harrison releases single "Ding Dong, Ding Dong"

41st Heisman Trophy Award: Archie Griffin, Ohio State (RB)

1975 Balcombe Street Siege: for 6 days, four Provisional Irish Republican Army volunteers hold two hostages at an apartment in London, England

Pieter Menten Arrested

Dutch war criminal Pieter Menten arrested in Zurich, Switzerland

South Africa grants Bophuthatswana independence

Spain adopts constitution

NASA launches Intelsat V satellite, no. 502

Rob de Castella of Australia sets Marathon record at 2:08:18

Droppin Well bombing: 11 British soldiers and 6 civilians are killed by an Irish National Liberation Army (INLA) time bomb at the Droppinâ Well Bar in Ballykelly, County Londonderry

A bomb planted on a bus in Jerusalem explodes, kills 6 Israelis

France performs nuclear test

1984 Hijackers aboard Kuwaiti jetliner kill 2nd hostage

52nd Heisman Trophy Award: Vinny Testaverde, Miami Fla (QB)

1986 France performs nuclear test at Mururoa atoll

3 satanist Missouri teenagers bludgeon comrade to death for "fun"

1987 Christa Rothenburger skates female world record 500m (39.39 sec)

Agnes Neil Williams purchases Baltimore Orioles for $70 million Eli Jacobs becomes CEO of Baltimore Orioles

1988 Carlos Andres Perez re-elected president of Venezuela

1988 Merv Hughes takes 13 wickets v WI at the WACA but Australia lose

1988 Milwaukee Bucks win their 1,000th NBA game (2nd fastest)

1988 Nelson Mandela is transferred to Victor Vester Prison, Capetown

1988 STS-27 Atlantis lands in California after secret mission

Arafat Meets US Jews

Yasser Arafat meets prominent American Jews in Stockholm, Sweden

Mafia drug kingpin bombs security force at Bogota, kills 52

1989 Worst Canadian mass murder: Marc Lepine kills 14 women at U Montreal

NHL grants conditional membership to Tampa Bay Lightning

Hussein Releases Hostages

Saddam Hussein announces release of all foreign hostages

1990 Shoeless Joe Jackson's signature sells, at aucton, for $23,100

"Star Trek VI-Undiscovered Country" premieres

300,000 hindus destroy mosque of Babri India, 4 die

Jerry Rice's Record Touchdown

San Francisco 49ers wide receiver Jerry Rice catches NFL record 101st touchdown in a 27-3 win over Miami Dolphins at Candlestick Park

Bonds' $43M Pact

San Francisco Giants sign record $43million USD pact with Pirates MLB outfielder Barry Bonds

Gunda Niemann skates ladies world record 5 km 7:13.29

Maltese Falcon auctioned for $398,590

1994 Orange County California files for bankruptcy

1994 Warner Brothers announces a 5th TV network to begin on Jan 11, 1995

Michael Jackson Collapses

Michael Jackson collapses while rehearsing for an HBO special

Mashonaland defeat England in first-class tour match

Hugo ChÃ¡vez Elected

Hugo ChÃ¡vez is elected President of Venezuela

British Museum's Great Court

Great Court of the British Museum redesigned with the largest covered courtyard in Europe by Foster & Partners opened by Queen Elizabeth II [1]

The Canadian province of Newfoundland is renamed Newfoundland and Labrador

Adaptation

"Adaptation" directed by Spike Jonze, starring Nicolas Cage and Meryl Streep premieres

Several villagers are shot dead during protests in Dongzhou, China

NASA reveals photographs taken by Mars Global Surveyor suggesting the presence of liquid water on Mars

Bettie Page Hospitalized

American pin-up model Bettie Page (85) is hospitalized in critical condition after suffering a heart attack

A Steady Rain

Final Broadway performance of "A Steady Rain", starring Hugh Jackman and Daniel Craig

Birds of America's Record Price

Record price for a printed book when a first edition of "The Birds of America" by John James Audubon auctioned at Sotheby's, London, England, for Â£7,321,250

7 people are killed and 770 injured during Egyptian protests

2012 A 243 million year old Nyasasaurus fossil is discovered in Tanzania

2012 Typhoon Bophaâs death toll rise to 418 with 318 missing and 179,000 displaced

A 2-year old boy dies from Ebola in Meliandou, Guinea

New Post for Abuse Cases

Pope Francis gives his ascent to a proposal to create a permanent post on the Pontifical Commission on cases of sin and sexual abuse of minors

"Supermassive" most distant black hole discovery announced by astronomers in journal "Nature", 13 billion light-years away, 800 x bigger than the Sun

Andrej BabiÅ¡ Sworn In

Andrej BabiÅ¡ is sworn as Prime Minister of the Czech Republic

2017 Brazilian drug lord RogÃ©rio da Silva arrested in Rio

2017 Britain's top Brexit negotiator David Davis admits there has been "no systematic impact assessment" on effects of Brexit

2017 Skirball wildfire near Los Angeles closes the Interstate 405 as thousands forced to evacuate

2017 Starbucks opens its largest cafe in the world in Shanghai, 30,000 square-feet, 1/2 size of a football field

2017 Time Magazine names their Person of the Year "The Silence Breakers", people who came forward to report sexual misconduct

Trump Recognizes Jerusalem

US President Donald Trump officially recognizes Jerusalem as Israel's capital, announcing plans to move US embassy there

Luxembourg is the first country to make all public transport free

2018 Oldest-known plague sample found in 4,900-year-old remains of 20-year old woman in GÃ¶khem, southern Sweden published in "Cell"

2018 Senegal's new Museum of Black Civilisations is opened in Dakar by President Macky Sall

Japanese space capsule Hayabusa-2 lands safely back on earth in Australia, carrying first significant rock samples from an asteroid, the Ryugu

2020 US President Donald Trump orders about 700 troops withdrawn from Somalia

2021 New York Mayor Bill de Blasio announces a COVID-19 mandate for all private employers effective December 27, to combat Omicron, 1st in the country

Argentine Vice-president Cristina FernÃ¡ndez de Kirchner found guilty of fraud, sentenced to six years in prison and banned from holding office [1]

2022 Donald Trump's real estate company Trump Organization convicted of tax fraud in New York [1]

2022 Indonesia passes a new criminal code outlawing sex outside marriage, even for foreigners [1]

2022 The 1,574th - and last - Boeing 747 jumbo jet rolls off of production line in Everett, Washington [1]

South Fork Wind, the first large-scale offshore wind farm begins supplying electricity to the US, 35 miles off Montauk [1]
